intro: Leucopogon ruscifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils in wetlands or pine forests. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, and it produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters. Leucopogon ruscifolius plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
